title.native: 劇場版 HUNTER×HUNTER 緋色の幻影（ファントム・ルージュ）

description: Kurapika became a Hunter to take vengeance on the Class-A crime group Phantom Troupe who massacred his clan for their unique eyes. The eyes of the Kurta clan turn scarlet in times of anger or emotional agitation and are considered the most beautiful treasures in the world. Kurapika continues to pursue the Phantom Troupe but an unknown party has stolen his "scarlet eyes". With the help of Gon, Killua and Leorio, Kurapika' s life was saved. However, the Phantom Troupe shows up before them and blocks their way. The true identity of the one with the No.4 spider tattoo is about to be unveiled.
synonyms: Gekijouban Hunter x Hunter: Hiiro no Genei

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Un4v5s8bgsVk9Xp)

A Japanese manga artist. He is most notable for having created [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/manga/30053/Yu-Yu-Hakusho/), for which he received the Shogakukan Manga Award in 1994, and [Hunter × Hunter](https://anilist.co/manga/30026/Hunter-x-Hunter/). In 1987, Togashi received the 34th Tezuka Award, the most influential new comic artist award in Japan, for his one-shot Buttobi Straight. 

Togashi is married to [Naoko Takeuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/96946/), the creator of [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/manga/30092/Sailor-Moon/). His brother, [Hideaki Togashi](https://anilist.co/staff/174009/), is also a manga artist and has helped him work on his series on multiple occasions. 

Since 2006, Hunter x Hunter has gone on numerous lengthy hiatuses due to varying reasons, Including but not limited to: Togashi's struggle with Lumbago, exhaustion, and his mental health. His physical and mental health was also a leading cause in the premature conclusion of Yu Yu Hakusho.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/75655903) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/something_Yoshimatsu/)

Affiliated with Studio Live since 1982. Studied under [Toyoo Ashida](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/). He has deep ties into [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) ever since working as a character designer on [Trigun](https://anilist.co/anime/6/) in 1998. A member of the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA).

Works as a mangaka under the name Something Yoshimatsu (サムシング吉松).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤雄三)

[Website](http://www.yoshihisahirano.com/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/Hirano_comp)

Studied composing at Juilliard School in 1992, and later at Eastman School of Music. Some of the awards he has received include first prize in the Axia Tape Competition in Japan during his high school years and New York's New Music for Young Ensembles. He has composed music for concert, dance, film and radio with compositions ranging from classical to pop and contemporary music. In recent years he has composed a number of anime soundtracks. He has also made music for Tokyo DisneySea's 2002 and 2004 countdown celebrations.    

Hirano has paired with pianist Masako Hosoda to form the unit Bleu and released two albums. He is also responsible for some of the orchestration and arrangement for a number of Ali Project's albums.

Yuzu (ゆず) is a Japanese popular music duo. Its members are Kitagawa Yujin (北川悠仁) and Iwasawa Kouji (岩沢厚治). Both of the band members come from Yokohama in Kanagawa Prefecture.  They were discovered as popular street musicians. At first, their band name was “Lights”, but Kitagawa thought that name was too hick, so they changed the name “Yuzu”. At that time, Kitagawa was eating a Yuzu sherbet, so he named their band after it. (Incidentally, Iwasawa ate vanilla ice cream. Perhaps the band name might have been Vanilla. Sometimes Iwasawa tells this story.) The fans of Yuzu are called “Yuzukko”.  In Jan 9 2013, They released their 37th single "REASON", The 1st track “REASON” Used as the 3rd ending theme song for “Hunter x Hunter 2011” anime. And as the theme song for the film “Hunter x Hunter: Phantom Rouge”

Anime Director. He began his career at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) where he would eventually make his directorial debut with [Claymore](https://anilist.co/anime/1818/). He then notably worked as Assistant Director throughout the [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/) adaptation at [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/), and has since continued to serve as Assistant and Episode Director on various projects there.

Affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [Producer](https://anilist.co/staff/155543) or other [Director](https://anilist.co/staff/226420) with the same name._

Anime Director. He began his career at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) where he would eventually make his directorial debut with [Claymore](https://anilist.co/anime/1818/). He then notably worked as Assistant Director throughout the [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/) adaptation at [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/), and has since continued to serve as Assistant and Episode Director on various projects there.

Affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [Producer](https://anilist.co/staff/155543) or other [Director](https://anilist.co/staff/226420) with the same name._

Director who started off as an animator. Still animates on occasions.

Married to [Sayo Aoi](https://anilist.co/staff/118784/).
Masamune Hirata is a Photographer under Rare Trick. He transitioned into directing under them too.

[Instagram 1](https://www.instagram.com/renanvidaldub/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/versaobrazueira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RenanVidalDub) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/renanvidaldub) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@versaobrazueira) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/RenanNest)

Renan Vidal is a Brazilian actor, voice actor and dubbing director.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Credence Barebone (Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them trilogy)
- Radicles X "Rad" (OK K.O.! Let's Be Heroes)
- Malcolm Stone (Never Have I Ever)
- Overflow (Ben 10 2016)
- Duncan P. Anderson (Monsters at Work)
- Ricardo "Ricky" Flores (O11CE)
- David Rose (2nd voice; Schitt's Creek)
- Joshua "Josh" Rosza (The Originals)
- Sky (2nd voice - 8th season; Winx Club)
- 'Mac' MacBentley (Zero Chill)
!~
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤雄三)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/兼森義則)
Originating from [Nomad](https://anilist.co/studio/70/).
Originating from [Nomad](https://anilist.co/studio/70/).

He made his debut as an animator on the show [Big X](https://anilist.co/anime/9613/), and joined Mushi Production working there as a director. Around 1975, he began working at Sanrio, which was just moving into the anime market, and wound up staying there for over a decade, going on to direct several of Sanrio's full-length theatrical features such as [Chirin no Suzu](https://anilist.co/anime/2199/), [Sirius no Densetsu](https://anilist.co/anime/2029/) and [Yousei Florence](https://anilist.co/anime/4943/).

He has been working as a freelancer since the breakup of Sanrio's animation department in 1985 following the release of the film Yousei Florence, directing and storyboarding for TV series and movies at various studios.

Director who started off as an animator. Still animates on occasions.

Married to [Sayo Aoi](https://anilist.co/staff/118784/).

Affiliated with [BUG FILMS](https://anilist.co/studio/7348). Formerly affiliated with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28).

He studied under [Yasukazu Shouji](https://anilist.co/staff/197550/Yasukazu-Shouji) and [Jouji Shimura](https://anilist.co/staff/148629/Jouji-Shimura) during his time at OLM.
